Ways to give
Individuals like you provide 90 percent of the funding that powers our lifesaving work.





For more than 50 years, MSF has provided medical humanitarian aid to people impacted by conflict, natural disasters, epidemics and more. We depend on our donors to help fund the lifesaving care we bring to those most in need around the world.
You can read about the many ways to give below, or visit our donation form to make a one-time or monthly contribution online.




 



Popular ways to give











Donate online
Support our life-saving work with a one-time donation.


Donate now














Give monthly
As a recurring donor, you play a vital role in ensuring that we are ready to save lives at a moment's notice.


Read more














Donate by mail
Simply print, complete, and mail in one of our short donation forms.


Learn more














Fundraise for us
Looking for a way to be a part of the MSF movement?


Learn more














Make a donation to honor someone
Our Tribute program is a wonderful way to show your support for our work around the world, while also honoring family and friends.


Learn more














Join the Partner program
Become a Partner and you'll be brought closer to our lifesaving work through special opportunities.


Learn more










 



Tax-smart ways to give











Donor-Advised Fund (DAF) donations
We’ve made it easy to initiate your grant recommendation.

Learn more














Donate stock and mutual funds
Your gift of stocks can save lives.

Learn more














Qualified Charitable Distributions
If you’re 70-1/2 or older, you can donate up to $108,000 per tax year directly from an Individual Retirement Account (IRA).

Learn more










 



Companies and foundations











Corporate support
Thanks to the independent support and generosity of companies like yours, our teams can provide emergency medical care where it’s needed most.


Learn more














Foundation support
Our foundation donors are vital to our work, making it possible for us to provide lifesaving care in over 70 countries around the world.


Learn more














Workplace giving & matching gifts
An easy way to give, and an easy way to increase your impact.


Learn more










 



Legacy giving and major giving











Legacy giving
A planned gift is a lasting investment that ensures our ability to provide medical aid to people caught in crisis.


Learn more














Major giving
With a cumulative contribution of $25,000 or more over two years, the support of our major donors provides MSF with the ability to provide care where it's needed most.


Learn more























 Isabel Corthier 



Donor Services

Get a receipt, update your info, or contact us.

Visit Donor Services









Donor Portal

View your recent donations, retrieve tax receipts, update your contact information, and manage your recurring donation through MSF’s Donor Portal.

  Log in 





 

Doctors Without Borders Donation FAQs
Do you have questions about donating to Doctors Without Borders? Browse our frequently asked questions to learn more about the donation process and options available when making a gift.



 




View


General donation questions
Financial accountability
Other ways to donate












General donation questions


When will I receive a receipt for my donation?



 

Please see the following list of when you will receive your donation receipt:

One-time donation: You will receive it in the mail between 3-4 weeks from the date of your gift.
Online donation: You will receive an email confirmation within the hour of your gift, in addition to a printed copy sent in the mail between 3-4 weeks.
Field Partner Program: You will automatically receive your total annual contribution at the end of each fiscal year (typically during the last week of January/first week of February).
Contribution of Stock: We received your gift without your contact information. To make sure we thank you for your donation and document it accordingly, please send an email containing your name, address, and the details of your stock to william.donas@newyork.msf.org.

If you have not received your acknowledgement or tax receipt within the time frames listed above, please fill out the request a receipt form, or contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, so that we can send it right away.








When will the recipient of my tribute gift receive notification? 



 

It can take up to four weeks for your recipient(s) to receive notification by mail. If it has been longer, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org and we will be sure to send the acknowledgement right away.  
Please note that tribute gifts submitted after December 5th may take longer to receive in the mail, in which you may want to consider sending an e-Card for an immediate notification.  
For more information, please visit our Make a Donation to Honor Someone page.








What is your Employer Identification Number (EIN)?



 

Our Federal Identification Number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.








How do I update my donation payment method?



 

To update your credit card information, or if you are using a checking or savings account, please contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and we can quickly update your information. 
We thank you for your continued support to Doctors Without Borders.








How do I change my recurring donation amount?



 

If you wish to update the amount of your pledge, you can:Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST








How do I stop or cancel my recurring donation?



 

We are grateful for your commitment to be a recurring donor and helping us prepare to save lives at a moment's notice. If you wish to update, suspend, or cancel your pledge you can: Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ESTWe understand that financial situations can change, in which you have the option to decrease the amount to be more manageable (please note that the minimum is $10.00), suspend your pledge so that it restarts at a time that is more convenient for you, or change your monthly donation to an annual or quarterly pledge.  No matter the amount, your reoccurring donation makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis our team responds to. Again, we are grateful for your support and helping us save lives. 








How do I stop or limit mail from Doctors Without Borders?



 

Our outbound mailing schedule can be tailored to meet your needs, whether it be quarterly, once a year, or none at all.  
To change your preferences, you can either: 

Fill out our Contact Preference form online, 
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, 
Or by emailing your name, mailing address and preference to donations@newyork.msf.org.

Please note that updates may require 6-8 weeks to take effect, as our mailing lists are compiled in advance. 








How do I contact Doctors Without Borders?



 

To contact Doctors Without Borders please see the following:
For mailed donations, please send them to our main processing center at: 
Doctors Without Borders - USA
PO Box 5030
Hagerstown, MD 21741-5030 
Our office headquarters are located at: 
40 Rector St., 16th Floor 
New York, NY 10006 
Phone: 212.679.6800 
Fax: 212.679.7016 
For further assistance please refer to our Contact Us page, or by calling our Donor Service team at (212)-763-5779 daily from 8am. to 11pm EST.








Will you share my contact information with any other organizations?



 

Doctors Without Borders respects the privacy of all our supporters and promotes transparency in everything we do. We do not sell or rent our mailing list to other organizations that solicit donations or sell any products; however, we exchange portions of our mailing list with select non-profit organizations with an agreement to keep donor information confidential. We do this to further reduce our fundraising costs, increase our efficiency, and most importantly improve your experience. 
If you prefer not to have your personal information disclosed in this manner, please contact our Donor Services Department at donations@newyork.msf.org, call us at 212.763.5779, or write to us by postal mail sent to Doctors Without Borders, Attn: Donor Services, 40 Rector St., 16th Floor, New York, NY 10006. 
For more information, please see us Privacy Policy.








Someone claiming to work for Doctors Without Borders has asked me for money. Can you verify that they really work for you?



 

Doctors Without Borders values the security and safety of all our field staff workers and it is our policy that we cannot verify employment. We acknowledge that there has been an increase in fraudulent activities on social network sites and we strongly advise against responding to requests for financial assistance. 
Preventative measures, such as routine online and media monitoring, are being conducted by our teams to protect supporters like you from running into any fraudulent situations.  
If you would like more information about our reported scams, please visit our Online Scams page. 








Can I earmark my donation for a certain area/project?



 

Yes, you can earmark your donation toward a specific program or country that we are working in; however, we ask that you consider contributing unrestricted funds so we can allocate our resources more efficiently where needs are the greatest. Our ability to provide rapid and targeted medical care to emergencies would not have been possible without the ongoing general support from our donors.
If you wish to restrict your donation, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org stating which country or program you would like the funds directed. In your email, please include your name, full address, and the amount of your donation to ensure your gift is redirected for your desired operation.
Unrestricted donations enable MSF to carry out our programs around the world. While we try to honor requests to earmark, should we receive more gifts than we can use for a program, we will reallocate them where the needs are greatest.
We thank you for your continued support to MSF and our operations.


















Financial accountability


Is Doctors Without Borders a nonprofit organization/NGO?



 

Yes, Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as an international nonprofit organization/NGO under the Internal Revenue Code section 501(c)(3).
Our Federal Tax ID number or Employer Identification Number (EIN) is 13-3433452.
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page.








Are donations to Doctors Without Borders tax-deductible?



 

Yes, 100% of your donation is tax deductible as Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. 
Our Federal Tax ID number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.  
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page. 








How much money does Doctors Without Borders raise? How does Doctors Without Borders get funding?



 

In 2023, Doctors Without Borders revenue was over $745.3 million—raised through private contributors, such as individuals, foundations, and corporations. 
In the interests of maintaining our independence and neutrality, Doctors Without Borders has not received or solicited funding from the US government since 2002. Internationally, we limit government funding to less than 20 percent of total funds raised. We strive to keep this figure as low as possible and currently it is at 2%. 
We have also established a corporate gift acceptance policy to alleviate the potential conflict between corporations or industries whose core activities may be in direct conflict with—or jeopardize—the goals of our medical humanitarian work, or in any way limit our ability to provide humanitarian assistance.  
These businesses include those that derive income from the production or sale of the following: 

Tobacco 
Alcohol 
Arms 
Pharmaceuticals (medicines, medical equipment, diagnostic and biotechnical materials, and research) 
Extractive industries (mineral, oil, or gas) 

For more information, please visit our Financial Reports page, or email Donor Services at donations@newyork.msf.org and we can further assist you.








What percentage of my donation goes to program activities?



 

85 cents of every dollar support our programs.  
Since 1995, Doctors Without Borders has maintained allocating more than 85 percent of its expenditure to its program activities. We strive to minimize fundraising and administrative costs, in which just 14 percent is spent on fundraising costs, and 1 percent on management.   
For more specific information about how we spend our donor funds, please visit our Financial Information page and see our annual reports. 


















Other ways to donate


Can I donate supplies to Doctors Without Borders?



 

We are grateful that you have considered Doctors Without Borders for your donation of medical equipment, drugs, food, or other materials for our operations, however, we are unable to accept these donations.  
After decades of experience, we’ve determined the best way to respond within moments’ notice is to have prepared, specialized, and uniform kits that are ready to go in the event of an emergency. These standardized emergency kits can get into the hands of our teams much more efficiently than if we had to manage the sorting, packing, and allocation of many different types of supplies. 
We recommend that you contact your local charitable organizations, which are often better equipped to distribute items to those in need within your community, or by visiting guidestar.org to find a suitable organization that accepts gifts in-kind. 
We thank you again for your support and consideration. 








Can I donate in a currency other than US dollars?



 

While Doctors Without Borders USA can only accept gifts in US dollars, we do have several offices around the world to give in your local currency.  
Please refer to our Offices Around the World page for further direction. 








Can I hold a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders?



 

Yes! Fundraising events are a great way to raise awareness and support for our medical work. For more resources and information on how to organize a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders, visit our fundraising page. 
If you’d like to speak to our fundraising staff about an event, contact us at 212.655.3759 or fundraisers@newyork.msf.org.








How do I donate in honor or memory of someone?



 

To donate in honor or memory of someone you can: 

Fill out our online form here
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org

Please note that it can take up to four weeks for a tribute notification letter to arrive. If you would like notification of a tribute donation to get to your recipient more quickly, please consider sending an ecard by visiting our Tribute Gift Donation page. After submitting your request, you will receive an email confirmation along with an official acknowledgement/tax receipt. 
For more information, please visit our tribute giving page, tribute acceptance guidelines, or by contacting Donor Services at (212) 763-5779 or donations@newyork.msf.org if we may be of any further assistance.








Can I give through a Donor-Advised Fund?



 

Yes, you can support our operations through your donor-advised fund (DAF).  
Please visit our Donor-Advised Funds page for more information.








Can I donate stock?



 

Yes, giving appreciated stocks, bonds or mutual funds is one of the most beneficial ways to donate to Doctors Without Borders. By simply transferring them into our account, the total value of the stock upon transfer is tax-deductible. There is no requirement to pay any capital gains taxes on the appreciation.  
To learn more about donating stocks, or to submit a stock gift form, visit our Donate Stocks page.  
You may also contact William Donas from Donor Services at 212.847.3158 or william.donas@newyork.msf.org for more assistance.








Does Doctors Without Borders have a Major Giving program?



 

Yes, anyone giving a total of $25,000 or more within one calendar year can be part of our Major Gifts program.  
To learn more about the benefits, please visit our Major Giving Page.








Does Doctors Without Borders offer planned or legacy giving?



 

Yes, a planned gift helps ensure Doctors Without Borders ability to respond to the challenges we face in the future. We have a wide range of planned gift options for you to choose from.
Please visit our Legacy Giving page for more information about your options.








How do I join Doctors Without Borders Field Partner giving program?



 

To become a reoccurring Field Partner, you can: 

Fill out our donation form online
Mailing our Field Partner Enrollment Form to PO Box 5030 Hagerstown, MD 21741 
Calling our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or by emailing us at donations@newyork.msf.org

This sustaining gift is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, you can be confident that your support will have a serious impact as it ensures the continuation of our operations and rapid response to emergencies throughout the world.








Will Doctors Without Borders accept a matching gift from my company?



 

Matching gift donations support Doctors Without Borders mission and can double or even triple the impact of our medical care around the world.  
Companies use various procedures by which employees can request matching gifts, however some companies that do not align with the goals and mission of Doctors Without Borders will not be matched. To check if your employer matches, please use our Matching Gift Finder on our Workplace Giving and Matching Gift page.  
Since each company has a different set of instructions for matching an employee gift, please see your company’s human resources department if you have questions about their matching gift policy. 
To learn more about our guidelines and policies, please visit our Corporate Gift Acceptance Policy page.








What is the Multiyear Initiative and how can I join?



 

The Multiyear Initiative encourages supporters to make significant long-term commitments to Doctors Without Borders. By making a multiyear commitment, donors help provide a predictable revenue stream that better serves our ability to respond rapidly to emergencies. 
To join this initiative, donors are asked to pledge a minimum of $5,000 per year for a three-to-five-year period. Your donations can be given quarterly or annually, in equal or increasing installments, whichever meets your desired needs and preferences. 
To learn more, please visit our Multiyear Initiative page.








Can I donate via wire transfer? 



 

Yes. Please reach out to donations@newyork.msf.org.








Can I make a monthly gift?



 

Yes, monthly donors provide a regular recurring gift that is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, your recurring donation has a serious impact: knowing we can count on receiving your recurring gift makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis we respond to next.
You can start your monthly gift and join our field partner program by submitting a recurring donation online, here.




















How you can help
Not everyone can treat patients in the field. But everyone can do something.
Some humanitarian crises make the headlines—others don’t. Unrestricted support from our donors allows us to mobilize quickly and efficiently to provide lifesaving medical care to the people who need it most, whether those needs are in the spotlight or not. And your donation is 100 percent tax-deductible.





We need your support to continue this lifesaving work
  Donate 






Hear from our medical staff and experts
  ATTEND AN EVENT 





Raise funds with friends

General donation questions


When will I receive a receipt for my donation?



 

Please see the following list of when you will receive your donation receipt:

One-time donation: You will receive it in the mail between 3-4 weeks from the date of your gift.
Online donation: You will receive an email confirmation within the hour of your gift, in addition to a printed copy sent in the mail between 3-4 weeks.
Field Partner Program: You will automatically receive your total annual contribution at the end of each fiscal year (typically during the last week of January/first week of February).
Contribution of Stock: We received your gift without your contact information. To make sure we thank you for your donation and document it accordingly, please send an email containing your name, address, and the details of your stock to william.donas@newyork.msf.org.

If you have not received your acknowledgement or tax receipt within the time frames listed above, please fill out the request a receipt form, or contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, so that we can send it right away.

Please note that tribute gifts submitted after December 5th may take longer to receive in the mail, in which you may want to consider sending an e-Card for an immediate notification.  
For more information, please visit our Make a Donation to Honor Someone page.

Our Federal Identification Number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.

We are grateful for your commitment to be a recurring donor and helping us prepare to save lives at a moment's notice. If you wish to update, suspend, or cancel your pledge you can: Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ESTWe understand that financial situations can change, in which you have the option to decrease the amount to be more manageable (please note that the minimum is $10.00), suspend your pledge so that it restarts at a time that is more convenient for you, or change your monthly donation to an annual or quarterly pledge.  No matter the amount, your reoccurring donation makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis our team responds to. Again, we are grateful for your support and helping us save lives.

Our outbound mailing schedule can be tailored to meet your needs, whether it be quarterly, once a year, or none at all.  
To change your preferences, you can either: 

Fill out our Contact Preference form online, 
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, 
Or by emailing your name, mailing address and preference to donations@newyork.msf.org.

Please note that updates may require 6-8 weeks to take effect, as our mailing lists are compiled in advance.

To contact Doctors Without Borders please see the following:
For mailed donations, please send them to our main processing center at: 
Doctors Without Borders - USA
PO Box 5030
Hagerstown, MD 21741-5030 
Our office headquarters are located at: 
40 Rector St., 16th Floor 
New York, NY 10006 
Phone: 212.679.6800 
Fax: 212.679.7016 
For further assistance please refer to our Contact Us page, or by calling our Donor Service team at (212)-763-5779 daily from 8am. to 11pm EST.








Will you share my contact information with any other organizations?



 

Doctors Without Borders respects the privacy of all our supporters and promotes transparency in everything we do. We do not sell or rent our mailing list to other organizations that solicit donations or sell any products; however, we exchange portions of our mailing list with select non-profit organizations with an agreement to keep donor information confidential. We do this to further reduce our fundraising costs, increase our efficiency, and most importantly improve your experience. 
If you prefer not to have your personal information disclosed in this manner, please contact our Donor Services Department at donations@newyork.msf.org, call us at 212.763.5779, or write to us by postal mail sent to Doctors Without Borders, Attn: Donor Services, 40 Rector St., 16th Floor, New York, NY 10006. 
For more information, please see us Privacy Policy.








Someone claiming to work for Doctors Without Borders has asked me for money. Can you verify that they really work for you?



 

Doctors Without Borders values the security and safety of all our field staff workers and it is our policy that we cannot verify employment. We acknowledge that there has been an increase in fraudulent activities on social network sites and we strongly advise against responding to requests for financial assistance. 
Preventative measures, such as routine online and media monitoring, are being conducted by our teams to protect supporters like you from running into any fraudulent situations.  
If you would like more information about our reported scams, please visit our Online Scams page. 








Can I earmark my donation for a certain area/project?



 

Yes, you can earmark your donation toward a specific program or country that we are working in; however, we ask that you consider contributing unrestricted funds so we can allocate our resources more efficiently where needs are the greatest. Our ability to provide rapid and targeted medical care to emergencies would not have been possible without the ongoing general support from our donors.
If you wish to restrict your donation, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org stating which country or program you would like the funds directed. In your email, please include your name, full address, and the amount of your donation to ensure your gift is redirected for your desired operation.
Unrestricted donations enable MSF to carry out our programs around the world. While we try to honor requests to earmark, should we receive more gifts than we can use for a program, we will reallocate them where the needs are greatest.
We thank you for your continued support to MSF and our operations.


















Financial accountability


Is Doctors Without Borders a nonprofit organization/NGO?



 

Yes, Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as an international nonprofit organization/NGO under the Internal Revenue Code section 501(c)(3).
Our Federal Tax ID number or Employer Identification Number (EIN) is 13-3433452.
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page.








Are donations to Doctors Without Borders tax-deductible?



 

Yes, 100% of your donation is tax deductible as Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. 
Our Federal Tax ID number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.  
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page. 








How much money does Doctors Without Borders raise? How does Doctors Without Borders get funding?



 

In 2023, Doctors Without Borders revenue was over $745.3 million—raised through private contributors, such as individuals, foundations, and corporations. 
In the interests of maintaining our independence and neutrality, Doctors Without Borders has not received or solicited funding from the US government since 2002. Internationally, we limit government funding to less than 20 percent of total funds raised. We strive to keep this figure as low as possible and currently it is at 2%. 
We have also established a corporate gift acceptance policy to alleviate the potential conflict between corporations or industries whose core activities may be in direct conflict with—or jeopardize—the goals of our medical humanitarian work, or in any way limit our ability to provide humanitarian assistance.  
These businesses include those that derive income from the production or sale of the following: 

Tobacco 
Alcohol 
Arms 
Pharmaceuticals (medicines, medical equipment, diagnostic and biotechnical materials, and research) 
Extractive industries (mineral, oil, or gas) 

For more information, please visit our Financial Reports page, or email Donor Services at donations@newyork.msf.org and we can further assist you.








What percentage of my donation goes to program activities?



 

85 cents of every dollar support our programs.  
Since 1995, Doctors Without Borders has maintained allocating more than 85 percent of its expenditure to its program activities. We strive to minimize fundraising and administrative costs, in which just 14 percent is spent on fundraising costs, and 1 percent on management.   
For more specific information about how we spend our donor funds, please visit our Financial Information page and see our annual reports. 


















Other ways to donate


Can I donate supplies to Doctors Without Borders?



 

We are grateful that you have considered Doctors Without Borders for your donation of medical equipment, drugs, food, or other materials for our operations, however, we are unable to accept these donations.  
After decades of experience, we’ve determined the best way to respond within moments’ notice is to have prepared, specialized, and uniform kits that are ready to go in the event of an emergency. These standardized emergency kits can get into the hands of our teams much more efficiently than if we had to manage the sorting, packing, and allocation of many different types of supplies. 
We recommend that you contact your local charitable organizations, which are often better equipped to distribute items to those in need within your community, or by visiting guidestar.org to find a suitable organization that accepts gifts in-kind. 
We thank you again for your support and consideration. 








Can I donate in a currency other than US dollars?



 

While Doctors Without Borders USA can only accept gifts in US dollars, we do have several offices around the world to give in your local currency.  
Please refer to our Offices Around the World page for further direction. 








Can I hold a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders?



 

Yes! Fundraising events are a great way to raise awareness and support for our medical work. For more resources and information on how to organize a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders, visit our fundraising page. 
If you’d like to speak to our fundraising staff about an event, contact us at 212.655.3759 or fundraisers@newyork.msf.org.








How do I donate in honor or memory of someone?



 

To donate in honor or memory of someone you can: 

Fill out our online form here
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org

Please note that it can take up to four weeks for a tribute notification letter to arrive. If you would like notification of a tribute donation to get to your recipient more quickly, please consider sending an ecard by visiting our Tribute Gift Donation page. After submitting your request, you will receive an email confirmation along with an official acknowledgement/tax receipt. 
For more information, please visit our tribute giving page, tribute acceptance guidelines, or by contacting Donor Services at (212) 763-5779 or donations@newyork.msf.org if we may be of any further assistance.








Can I give through a Donor-Advised Fund?



 

Yes, you can support our operations through your donor-advised fund (DAF).  
Please visit our Donor-Advised Funds page for more information.








Can I donate stock?



 

Yes, giving appreciated stocks, bonds or mutual funds is one of the most beneficial ways to donate to Doctors Without Borders. By simply transferring them into our account, the total value of the stock upon transfer is tax-deductible. There is no requirement to pay any capital gains taxes on the appreciation.  
To learn more about donating stocks, or to submit a stock gift form, visit our Donate Stocks page.  
You may also contact William Donas from Donor Services at 212.847.3158 or william.donas@newyork.msf.org for more assistance.








Does Doctors Without Borders have a Major Giving program?



 

Yes, anyone giving a total of $25,000 or more within one calendar year can be part of our Major Gifts program.  
To learn more about the benefits, please visit our Major Giving Page.








Does Doctors Without Borders offer planned or legacy giving?



 

Yes, a planned gift helps ensure Doctors Without Borders ability to respond to the challenges we face in the future. We have a wide range of planned gift options for you to choose from.
Please visit our Legacy Giving page for more information about your options.








How do I join Doctors Without Borders Field Partner giving program?



 

To become a reoccurring Field Partner, you can: 

Fill out our donation form online
Mailing our Field Partner Enrollment Form to PO Box 5030 Hagerstown, MD 21741 
Calling our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or by emailing us at donations@newyork.msf.org

This sustaining gift is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, you can be confident that your support will have a serious impact as it ensures the continuation of our operations and rapid response to emergencies throughout the world.








Will Doctors Without Borders accept a matching gift from my company?



 

Matching gift donations support Doctors Without Borders mission and can double or even triple the impact of our medical care around the world.  
Companies use various procedures by which employees can request matching gifts, however some companies that do not align with the goals and mission of Doctors Without Borders will not be matched. To check if your employer matches, please use our Matching Gift Finder on our Workplace Giving and Matching Gift page.  
Since each company has a different set of instructions for matching an employee gift, please see your company’s human resources department if you have questions about their matching gift policy. 
To learn more about our guidelines and policies, please visit our Corporate Gift Acceptance Policy page.








What is the Multiyear Initiative and how can I join?



 

The Multiyear Initiative encourages supporters to make significant long-term commitments to Doctors Without Borders. By making a multiyear commitment, donors help provide a predictable revenue stream that better serves our ability to respond rapidly to emergencies. 
To join this initiative, donors are asked to pledge a minimum of $5,000 per year for a three-to-five-year period. Your donations can be given quarterly or annually, in equal or increasing installments, whichever meets your desired needs and preferences. 
To learn more, please visit our Multiyear Initiative page.








Can I donate via wire transfer? 



 

Yes. Please reach out to donations@newyork.msf.org.








Can I make a monthly gift?



 

Yes, monthly donors provide a regular recurring gift that is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, your recurring donation has a serious impact: knowing we can count on receiving your recurring gift makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis we respond to next.
You can start your monthly gift and join our field partner program by submitting a recurring donation online, here.

Not everyone can treat patients in the field. But everyone can do something.
Some humanitarian crises make the headlines—others don’t. Unrestricted support from our donors allows us to mobilize quickly and efficiently to provide lifesaving medical care to the people who need it most, whether those needs are in the spotlight or not. And your donation is 100 percent tax-deductible.

General donation questions


When will I receive a receipt for my donation?



 

Please see the following list of when you will receive your donation receipt:

One-time donation: You will receive it in the mail between 3-4 weeks from the date of your gift.
Online donation: You will receive an email confirmation within the hour of your gift, in addition to a printed copy sent in the mail between 3-4 weeks.
Field Partner Program: You will automatically receive your total annual contribution at the end of each fiscal year (typically during the last week of January/first week of February).
Contribution of Stock: We received your gift without your contact information. To make sure we thank you for your donation and document it accordingly, please send an email containing your name, address, and the details of your stock to william.donas@newyork.msf.org.

If you have not received your acknowledgement or tax receipt within the time frames listed above, please fill out the request a receipt form, or contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, so that we can send it right away.








When will the recipient of my tribute gift receive notification? 



 

It can take up to four weeks for your recipient(s) to receive notification by mail. If it has been longer, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org and we will be sure to send the acknowledgement right away.  
Please note that tribute gifts submitted after December 5th may take longer to receive in the mail, in which you may want to consider sending an e-Card for an immediate notification.  
For more information, please visit our Make a Donation to Honor Someone page.








What is your Employer Identification Number (EIN)?



 

Our Federal Identification Number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.








How do I update my donation payment method?



 

To update your credit card information, or if you are using a checking or savings account, please contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and we can quickly update your information. 
We thank you for your continued support to Doctors Without Borders.








How do I change my recurring donation amount?



 

If you wish to update the amount of your pledge, you can:Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST








How do I stop or cancel my recurring donation?



 

We are grateful for your commitment to be a recurring donor and helping us prepare to save lives at a moment's notice. If you wish to update, suspend, or cancel your pledge you can: Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ESTWe understand that financial situations can change, in which you have the option to decrease the amount to be more manageable (please note that the minimum is $10.00), suspend your pledge so that it restarts at a time that is more convenient for you, or change your monthly donation to an annual or quarterly pledge.  No matter the amount, your reoccurring donation makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis our team responds to. Again, we are grateful for your support and helping us save lives. 








How do I stop or limit mail from Doctors Without Borders?



 

Our outbound mailing schedule can be tailored to meet your needs, whether it be quarterly, once a year, or none at all.  
To change your preferences, you can either: 

Fill out our Contact Preference form online, 
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, 
Or by emailing your name, mailing address and preference to donations@newyork.msf.org.

Please note that updates may require 6-8 weeks to take effect, as our mailing lists are compiled in advance. 








How do I contact Doctors Without Borders?



 

To contact Doctors Without Borders please see the following:
For mailed donations, please send them to our main processing center at: 
Doctors Without Borders - USA
PO Box 5030
Hagerstown, MD 21741-5030 
Our office headquarters are located at: 
40 Rector St., 16th Floor 
New York, NY 10006 
Phone: 212.679.6800 
Fax: 212.679.7016 
For further assistance please refer to our Contact Us page, or by calling our Donor Service team at (212)-763-5779 daily from 8am. to 11pm EST.








Will you share my contact information with any other organizations?



 

Doctors Without Borders respects the privacy of all our supporters and promotes transparency in everything we do. We do not sell or rent our mailing list to other organizations that solicit donations or sell any products; however, we exchange portions of our mailing list with select non-profit organizations with an agreement to keep donor information confidential. We do this to further reduce our fundraising costs, increase our efficiency, and most importantly improve your experience. 
If you prefer not to have your personal information disclosed in this manner, please contact our Donor Services Department at donations@newyork.msf.org, call us at 212.763.5779, or write to us by postal mail sent to Doctors Without Borders, Attn: Donor Services, 40 Rector St., 16th Floor, New York, NY 10006. 
For more information, please see us Privacy Policy.

Preventative measures, such as routine online and media monitoring, are being conducted by our teams to protect supporters like you from running into any fraudulent situations.  
If you would like more information about our reported scams, please visit our Online Scams page.

Our ability to provide rapid and targeted medical care to emergencies would not have been possible without the ongoing general support from our donors.

Will Doctors Without Borders accept a matching gift from my company?



 

Matching gift donations support Doctors Without Borders mission and can double or even triple the impact of our medical care around the world.  
Companies use various procedures by which employees can request matching gifts, however some companies that do not align with the goals and mission of Doctors Without Borders will not be matched. To check if your employer matches, please use our Matching Gift Finder on our Workplace Giving and Matching Gift page.  
Since each company has a different set of instructions for matching an employee gift, please see your company’s human resources department if you have questions about their matching gift policy. 
To learn more about our guidelines and policies, please visit our Corporate Gift Acceptance Policy page.








What is the Multiyear Initiative and how can I join?



 

The Multiyear Initiative encourages supporters to make significant long-term commitments to Doctors Without Borders. By making a multiyear commitment, donors help provide a predictable revenue stream that better serves our ability to respond rapidly to emergencies. 
To join this initiative, donors are asked to pledge a minimum of $5,000 per year for a three-to-five-year period. Your donations can be given quarterly or annually, in equal or increasing installments, whichever meets your desired needs and preferences. 
To learn more, please visit our Multiyear Initiative page.








Can I donate via wire transfer? 



 

Yes. Please reach out to donations@newyork.msf.org.








Can I make a monthly gift?



 

Yes, monthly donors provide a regular recurring gift that is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, your recurring donation has a serious impact: knowing we can count on receiving your recurring gift makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis we respond to next.
You can start your monthly gift and join our field partner program by submitting a recurring donation online, here.

Unrestricted support from our donors allows us to mobilize quickly and efficiently to provide lifesaving medical care to the people who need it most, whether those needs are in the spotlight or not. And your donation is 100 percent tax-deductible.

General donation questions


When will I receive a receipt for my donation?



 

Please see the following list of when you will receive your donation receipt:

One-time donation: You will receive it in the mail between 3-4 weeks from the date of your gift.
Online donation: You will receive an email confirmation within the hour of your gift, in addition to a printed copy sent in the mail between 3-4 weeks.
Field Partner Program: You will automatically receive your total annual contribution at the end of each fiscal year (typically during the last week of January/first week of February).
Contribution of Stock: We received your gift without your contact information. To make sure we thank you for your donation and document it accordingly, please send an email containing your name, address, and the details of your stock to william.donas@newyork.msf.org.

If you have not received your acknowledgement or tax receipt within the time frames listed above, please fill out the request a receipt form, or contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, so that we can send it right away.








When will the recipient of my tribute gift receive notification? 



 

It can take up to four weeks for your recipient(s) to receive notification by mail. If it has been longer, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org and we will be sure to send the acknowledgement right away.  
Please note that tribute gifts submitted after December 5th may take longer to receive in the mail, in which you may want to consider sending an e-Card for an immediate notification.  
For more information, please visit our Make a Donation to Honor Someone page.








What is your Employer Identification Number (EIN)?



 

Our Federal Identification Number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.








How do I update my donation payment method?



 

To update your credit card information, or if you are using a checking or savings account, please contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST and we can quickly update your information. 
We thank you for your continued support to Doctors Without Borders.








How do I change my recurring donation amount?



 

If you wish to update the amount of your pledge, you can:Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST








How do I stop or cancel my recurring donation?



 

We are grateful for your commitment to be a recurring donor and helping us prepare to save lives at a moment's notice. If you wish to update, suspend, or cancel your pledge you can: Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ESTWe understand that financial situations can change, in which you have the option to decrease the amount to be more manageable (please note that the minimum is $10.00), suspend your pledge so that it restarts at a time that is more convenient for you, or change your monthly donation to an annual or quarterly pledge.  No matter the amount, your reoccurring donation makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis our team responds to. Again, we are grateful for your support and helping us save lives. 








How do I stop or limit mail from Doctors Without Borders?



 

Our outbound mailing schedule can be tailored to meet your needs, whether it be quarterly, once a year, or none at all.  
To change your preferences, you can either: 

Fill out our Contact Preference form online, 
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, 
Or by emailing your name, mailing address and preference to donations@newyork.msf.org.

Please note that updates may require 6-8 weeks to take effect, as our mailing lists are compiled in advance. 








How do I contact Doctors Without Borders?



 

To contact Doctors Without Borders please see the following:
For mailed donations, please send them to our main processing center at: 
Doctors Without Borders - USA
PO Box 5030
Hagerstown, MD 21741-5030 
Our office headquarters are located at: 
40 Rector St., 16th Floor 
New York, NY 10006 
Phone: 212.679.6800 
Fax: 212.679.7016 
For further assistance please refer to our Contact Us page, or by calling our Donor Service team at (212)-763-5779 daily from 8am. to 11pm EST.








Will you share my contact information with any other organizations?



 

Doctors Without Borders respects the privacy of all our supporters and promotes transparency in everything we do. We do not sell or rent our mailing list to other organizations that solicit donations or sell any products; however, we exchange portions of our mailing list with select non-profit organizations with an agreement to keep donor information confidential. We do this to further reduce our fundraising costs, increase our efficiency, and most importantly improve your experience. 
If you prefer not to have your personal information disclosed in this manner, please contact our Donor Services Department at donations@newyork.msf.org, call us at 212.763.5779, or write to us by postal mail sent to Doctors Without Borders, Attn: Donor Services, 40 Rector St., 16th Floor, New York, NY 10006. 
For more information, please see us Privacy Policy.








Someone claiming to work for Doctors Without Borders has asked me for money. Can you verify that they really work for you?



 

Doctors Without Borders values the security and safety of all our field staff workers and it is our policy that we cannot verify employment. We acknowledge that there has been an increase in fraudulent activities on social network sites and we strongly advise against responding to requests for financial assistance. 
Preventative measures, such as routine online and media monitoring, are being conducted by our teams to protect supporters like you from running into any fraudulent situations.  
If you would like more information about our reported scams, please visit our Online Scams page. 








Can I earmark my donation for a certain area/project?



 

Yes, you can earmark your donation toward a specific program or country that we are working in; however, we ask that you consider contributing unrestricted funds so we can allocate our resources more efficiently where needs are the greatest. Our ability to provide rapid and targeted medical care to emergencies would not have been possible without the ongoing general support from our donors.
If you wish to restrict your donation, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org stating which country or program you would like the funds directed. In your email, please include your name, full address, and the amount of your donation to ensure your gift is redirected for your desired operation.
Unrestricted donations enable MSF to carry out our programs around the world. While we try to honor requests to earmark, should we receive more gifts than we can use for a program, we will reallocate them where the needs are greatest.
We thank you for your continued support to MSF and our operations.


















Financial accountability


Is Doctors Without Borders a nonprofit organization/NGO?



 

Yes, Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as an international nonprofit organization/NGO under the Internal Revenue Code section 501(c)(3).
Our Federal Tax ID number or Employer Identification Number (EIN) is 13-3433452.
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page.








Are donations to Doctors Without Borders tax-deductible?



 

Yes, 100% of your donation is tax deductible as Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. 
Our Federal Tax ID number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.  
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page. 








How much money does Doctors Without Borders raise? How does Doctors Without Borders get funding?



 

In 2023, Doctors Without Borders revenue was over $745.3 million—raised through private contributors, such as individuals, foundations, and corporations. 
In the interests of maintaining our independence and neutrality, Doctors Without Borders has not received or solicited funding from the US government since 2002. Internationally, we limit government funding to less than 20 percent of total funds raised. We strive to keep this figure as low as possible and currently it is at 2%. 
We have also established a corporate gift acceptance policy to alleviate the potential conflict between corporations or industries whose core activities may be in direct conflict with—or jeopardize—the goals of our medical humanitarian work, or in any way limit our ability to provide humanitarian assistance.  
These businesses include those that derive income from the production or sale of the following: 

Tobacco 
Alcohol 
Arms 
Pharmaceuticals (medicines, medical equipment, diagnostic and biotechnical materials, and research) 
Extractive industries (mineral, oil, or gas) 

For more information, please visit our Financial Reports page, or email Donor Services at donations@newyork.msf.org and we can further assist you.








What percentage of my donation goes to program activities?



 

85 cents of every dollar support our programs.  
Since 1995, Doctors Without Borders has maintained allocating more than 85 percent of its expenditure to its program activities. We strive to minimize fundraising and administrative costs, in which just 14 percent is spent on fundraising costs, and 1 percent on management.   
For more specific information about how we spend our donor funds, please visit our Financial Information page and see our annual reports. 


















Other ways to donate


Can I donate supplies to Doctors Without Borders?



 

We are grateful that you have considered Doctors Without Borders for your donation of medical equipment, drugs, food, or other materials for our operations, however, we are unable to accept these donations.  
After decades of experience, we’ve determined the best way to respond within moments’ notice is to have prepared, specialized, and uniform kits that are ready to go in the event of an emergency. These standardized emergency kits can get into the hands of our teams much more efficiently than if we had to manage the sorting, packing, and allocation of many different types of supplies. 
We recommend that you contact your local charitable organizations, which are often better equipped to distribute items to those in need within your community, or by visiting guidestar.org to find a suitable organization that accepts gifts in-kind. 
We thank you again for your support and consideration. 








Can I donate in a currency other than US dollars?



 

While Doctors Without Borders USA can only accept gifts in US dollars, we do have several offices around the world to give in your local currency.  
Please refer to our Offices Around the World page for further direction. 








Can I hold a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders?



 

Yes! Fundraising events are a great way to raise awareness and support for our medical work. For more resources and information on how to organize a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders, visit our fundraising page. 
If you’d like to speak to our fundraising staff about an event, contact us at 212.655.3759 or fundraisers@newyork.msf.org.








How do I donate in honor or memory of someone?



 

To donate in honor or memory of someone you can: 

Fill out our online form here
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org

Please note that it can take up to four weeks for a tribute notification letter to arrive. If you would like notification of a tribute donation to get to your recipient more quickly, please consider sending an ecard by visiting our Tribute Gift Donation page. After submitting your request, you will receive an email confirmation along with an official acknowledgement/tax receipt. 
For more information, please visit our tribute giving page, tribute acceptance guidelines, or by contacting Donor Services at (212) 763-5779 or donations@newyork.msf.org if we may be of any further assistance.








Can I give through a Donor-Advised Fund?



 

Yes, you can support our operations through your donor-advised fund (DAF).  
Please visit our Donor-Advised Funds page for more information.








Can I donate stock?



 

Yes, giving appreciated stocks, bonds or mutual funds is one of the most beneficial ways to donate to Doctors Without Borders. By simply transferring them into our account, the total value of the stock upon transfer is tax-deductible. There is no requirement to pay any capital gains taxes on the appreciation.  
To learn more about donating stocks, or to submit a stock gift form, visit our Donate Stocks page.  
You may also contact William Donas from Donor Services at 212.847.3158 or william.donas@newyork.msf.org for more assistance.








Does Doctors Without Borders have a Major Giving program?



 

Yes, anyone giving a total of $25,000 or more within one calendar year can be part of our Major Gifts program.  
To learn more about the benefits, please visit our Major Giving Page.








Does Doctors Without Borders offer planned or legacy giving?



 

Yes, a planned gift helps ensure Doctors Without Borders ability to respond to the challenges we face in the future. We have a wide range of planned gift options for you to choose from.
Please visit our Legacy Giving page for more information about your options.








How do I join Doctors Without Borders Field Partner giving program?



 

To become a reoccurring Field Partner, you can: 

Fill out our donation form online
Mailing our Field Partner Enrollment Form to PO Box 5030 Hagerstown, MD 21741 
Calling our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or by emailing us at donations@newyork.msf.org

This sustaining gift is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, you can be confident that your support will have a serious impact as it ensures the continuation of our operations and rapid response to emergencies throughout the world.








Will Doctors Without Borders accept a matching gift from my company?



 

Matching gift donations support Doctors Without Borders mission and can double or even triple the impact of our medical care around the world.  
Companies use various procedures by which employees can request matching gifts, however some companies that do not align with the goals and mission of Doctors Without Borders will not be matched. To check if your employer matches, please use our Matching Gift Finder on our Workplace Giving and Matching Gift page.  
Since each company has a different set of instructions for matching an employee gift, please see your company’s human resources department if you have questions about their matching gift policy. 
To learn more about our guidelines and policies, please visit our Corporate Gift Acceptance Policy page.








What is the Multiyear Initiative and how can I join?



 

The Multiyear Initiative encourages supporters to make significant long-term commitments to Doctors Without Borders. By making a multiyear commitment, donors help provide a predictable revenue stream that better serves our ability to respond rapidly to emergencies. 
To join this initiative, donors are asked to pledge a minimum of $5,000 per year for a three-to-five-year period. Your donations can be given quarterly or annually, in equal or increasing installments, whichever meets your desired needs and preferences. 
To learn more, please visit our Multiyear Initiative page.

Yes. Please reach out to donations@newyork.msf.org.

Yes, monthly donors provide a regular recurring gift that is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, your recurring donation has a serious impact: knowing we can count on receiving your recurring gift makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis we respond to next.

Phone: 212.679.6800 
Fax: 212.679.7016 
For further assistance please refer to our Contact Us page, or by calling our Donor Service team at (212)-763-5779 daily from 8am. to 11pm EST.








Will you share my contact information with any other organizations?



 

Doctors Without Borders respects the privacy of all our supporters and promotes transparency in everything we do. We do not sell or rent our mailing list to other organizations that solicit donations or sell any products; however, we exchange portions of our mailing list with select non-profit organizations with an agreement to keep donor information confidential. We do this to further reduce our fundraising costs, increase our efficiency, and most importantly improve your experience. 
If you prefer not to have your personal information disclosed in this manner, please contact our Donor Services Department at donations@newyork.msf.org, call us at 212.763.5779, or write to us by postal mail sent to Doctors Without Borders, Attn: Donor Services, 40 Rector St., 16th Floor, New York, NY 10006. 
For more information, please see us Privacy Policy.








Someone claiming to work for Doctors Without Borders has asked me for money. Can you verify that they really work for you?



 

Doctors Without Borders values the security and safety of all our field staff workers and it is our policy that we cannot verify employment. We acknowledge that there has been an increase in fraudulent activities on social network sites and we strongly advise against responding to requests for financial assistance. 
Preventative measures, such as routine online and media monitoring, are being conducted by our teams to protect supporters like you from running into any fraudulent situations.  
If you would like more information about our reported scams, please visit our Online Scams page. 








Can I earmark my donation for a certain area/project?



 

Yes, you can earmark your donation toward a specific program or country that we are working in; however, we ask that you consider contributing unrestricted funds so we can allocate our resources more efficiently where needs are the greatest. Our ability to provide rapid and targeted medical care to emergencies would not have been possible without the ongoing general support from our donors.
If you wish to restrict your donation, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org stating which country or program you would like the funds directed. In your email, please include your name, full address, and the amount of your donation to ensure your gift is redirected for your desired operation.
Unrestricted donations enable MSF to carry out our programs around the world. While we try to honor requests to earmark, should we receive more gifts than we can use for a program, we will reallocate them where the needs are greatest.
We thank you for your continued support to MSF and our operations.


















Financial accountability


Is Doctors Without Borders a nonprofit organization/NGO?



 

Yes, Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as an international nonprofit organization/NGO under the Internal Revenue Code section 501(c)(3).
Our Federal Tax ID number or Employer Identification Number (EIN) is 13-3433452.
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page.








Are donations to Doctors Without Borders tax-deductible?



 

Yes, 100% of your donation is tax deductible as Doctors Without Borders USA, Inc. is recognized as tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. 
Our Federal Tax ID number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.  
For more information, please visit our Financial Information page. 








How much money does Doctors Without Borders raise? How does Doctors Without Borders get funding?



 

In 2023, Doctors Without Borders revenue was over $745.3 million—raised through private contributors, such as individuals, foundations, and corporations. 
In the interests of maintaining our independence and neutrality, Doctors Without Borders has not received or solicited funding from the US government since 2002. Internationally, we limit government funding to less than 20 percent of total funds raised. We strive to keep this figure as low as possible and currently it is at 2%. 
We have also established a corporate gift acceptance policy to alleviate the potential conflict between corporations or industries whose core activities may be in direct conflict with—or jeopardize—the goals of our medical humanitarian work, or in any way limit our ability to provide humanitarian assistance.  
These businesses include those that derive income from the production or sale of the following: 

Tobacco 
Alcohol 
Arms 
Pharmaceuticals (medicines, medical equipment, diagnostic and biotechnical materials, and research) 
Extractive industries (mineral, oil, or gas) 

For more information, please visit our Financial Reports page, or email Donor Services at donations@newyork.msf.org and we can further assist you.








What percentage of my donation goes to program activities?



 

85 cents of every dollar support our programs.  
Since 1995, Doctors Without Borders has maintained allocating more than 85 percent of its expenditure to its program activities. We strive to minimize fundraising and administrative costs, in which just 14 percent is spent on fundraising costs, and 1 percent on management.   
For more specific information about how we spend our donor funds, please visit our Financial Information page and see our annual reports. 


















Other ways to donate


Can I donate supplies to Doctors Without Borders?



 

We are grateful that you have considered Doctors Without Borders for your donation of medical equipment, drugs, food, or other materials for our operations, however, we are unable to accept these donations.  
After decades of experience, we’ve determined the best way to respond within moments’ notice is to have prepared, specialized, and uniform kits that are ready to go in the event of an emergency. These standardized emergency kits can get into the hands of our teams much more efficiently than if we had to manage the sorting, packing, and allocation of many different types of supplies. 
We recommend that you contact your local charitable organizations, which are often better equipped to distribute items to those in need within your community, or by visiting guidestar.org to find a suitable organization that accepts gifts in-kind. 
We thank you again for your support and consideration. 








Can I donate in a currency other than US dollars?



 

While Doctors Without Borders USA can only accept gifts in US dollars, we do have several offices around the world to give in your local currency.  
Please refer to our Offices Around the World page for further direction. 








Can I hold a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders?



 

Yes! Fundraising events are a great way to raise awareness and support for our medical work. For more resources and information on how to organize a fundraiser for Doctors Without Borders, visit our fundraising page. 
If you’d like to speak to our fundraising staff about an event, contact us at 212.655.3759 or fundraisers@newyork.msf.org.








How do I donate in honor or memory of someone?



 

To donate in honor or memory of someone you can: 

Fill out our online form here
Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org

Please note that it can take up to four weeks for a tribute notification letter to arrive. If you would like notification of a tribute donation to get to your recipient more quickly, please consider sending an ecard by visiting our Tribute Gift Donation page. After submitting your request, you will receive an email confirmation along with an official acknowledgement/tax receipt. 
For more information, please visit our tribute giving page, tribute acceptance guidelines, or by contacting Donor Services at (212) 763-5779 or donations@newyork.msf.org if we may be of any further assistance.








Can I give through a Donor-Advised Fund?



 

Yes, you can support our operations through your donor-advised fund (DAF).  
Please visit our Donor-Advised Funds page for more information.








Can I donate stock?



 

Yes, giving appreciated stocks, bonds or mutual funds is one of the most beneficial ways to donate to Doctors Without Borders. By simply transferring them into our account, the total value of the stock upon transfer is tax-deductible. There is no requirement to pay any capital gains taxes on the appreciation.  
To learn more about donating stocks, or to submit a stock gift form, visit our Donate Stocks page.  
You may also contact William Donas from Donor Services at 212.847.3158 or william.donas@newyork.msf.org for more assistance.








Does Doctors Without Borders have a Major Giving program?



 

Yes, anyone giving a total of $25,000 or more within one calendar year can be part of our Major Gifts program.  
To learn more about the benefits, please visit our Major Giving Page.








Does Doctors Without Borders offer planned or legacy giving?



 

Yes, a planned gift helps ensure Doctors Without Borders ability to respond to the challenges we face in the future. We have a wide range of planned gift options for you to choose from.
Please visit our Legacy Giving page for more information about your options.








How do I join Doctors Without Borders Field Partner giving program?



 

To become a reoccurring Field Partner, you can: 

Fill out our donation form online
Mailing our Field Partner Enrollment Form to PO Box 5030 Hagerstown, MD 21741 
Calling our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST
Or by emailing us at donations@newyork.msf.org

This sustaining gift is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, you can be confident that your support will have a serious impact as it ensures the continuation of our operations and rapid response to emergencies throughout the world.








Will Doctors Without Borders accept a matching gift from my company?



 

Matching gift donations support Doctors Without Borders mission and can double or even triple the impact of our medical care around the world.  
Companies use various procedures by which employees can request matching gifts, however some companies that do not align with the goals and mission of Doctors Without Borders will not be matched. To check if your employer matches, please use our Matching Gift Finder on our Workplace Giving and Matching Gift page.  
Since each company has a different set of instructions for matching an employee gift, please see your company’s human resources department if you have questions about their matching gift policy. 
To learn more about our guidelines and policies, please visit our Corporate Gift Acceptance Policy page.








What is the Multiyear Initiative and how can I join?



 

The Multiyear Initiative encourages supporters to make significant long-term commitments to Doctors Without Borders. By making a multiyear commitment, donors help provide a predictable revenue stream that better serves our ability to respond rapidly to emergencies. 
To join this initiative, donors are asked to pledge a minimum of $5,000 per year for a three-to-five-year period. Your donations can be given quarterly or annually, in equal or increasing installments, whichever meets your desired needs and preferences. 
To learn more, please visit our Multiyear Initiative page.








Can I donate via wire transfer? 



 

Yes. Please reach out to donations@newyork.msf.org.








Can I make a monthly gift?



 

Yes, monthly donors provide a regular recurring gift that is automatically transferred from a credit card or bank account and can be adjusted or suspended at any time. No matter the amount, your recurring donation has a serious impact: knowing we can count on receiving your recurring gift makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis we respond to next.
You can start your monthly gift and join our field partner program by submitting a recurring donation online, here.

General donation questions


When will I receive a receipt for my donation?



 

Please see the following list of when you will receive your donation receipt:

One-time donation: You will receive it in the mail between 3-4 weeks from the date of your gift.
Online donation: You will receive an email confirmation within the hour of your gift, in addition to a printed copy sent in the mail between 3-4 weeks.
Field Partner Program: You will automatically receive your total annual contribution at the end of each fiscal year (typically during the last week of January/first week of February).
Contribution of Stock: We received your gift without your contact information. To make sure we thank you for your donation and document it accordingly, please send an email containing your name, address, and the details of your stock to william.donas@newyork.msf.org.

If you have not received your acknowledgement or tax receipt within the time frames listed above, please fill out the request a receipt form, or contact our Donor Services team by calling us toll-free at 1.888.392.0392, daily 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. EST, so that we can send it right away.








When will the recipient of my tribute gift receive notification? 



 

It can take up to four weeks for your recipient(s) to receive notification by mail. If it has been longer, please send an email to donations@newyork.msf.org and we will be sure to send the acknowledgement right away.  
Please note that tribute gifts submitted after December 5th may take longer to receive in the mail, in which you may want to consider sending an e-Card for an immediate notification.  
For more information, please visit our Make a Donation to Honor Someone page.








What is your Employer Identification Number (EIN)?



 

Our Federal Identification Number, or Employer Identification Number (EIN), is 13-3433452.








How do I update my donation payment method?

We thank you for your continued support to Doctors Without Borders.








How do I change my recurring donation amount?

How do I stop or cancel my recurring donation?



 

We are grateful for your commitment to be a recurring donor and helping us prepare to save lives at a moment's notice. If you wish to update, suspend, or cancel your pledge you can: Access your account through our Donor PortalSubmit your request using our online Update Your Field Partner Pledge form (this method does not require you to log in to your account)  Call our Donor Services team toll-free at 1.888.392.0392 daily from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. ESTWe understand that financial situations can change, in which you have the option to decrease the amount to be more manageable (please note that the minimum is $10.00), suspend your pledge so that it restarts at a time that is more convenient for you, or change your monthly donation to an annual or quarterly pledge.  No matter the amount, your reoccurring donation makes it easier for us to be prepared for whatever emergency or crisis our team responds to. Again, we are grateful for your support and helping us save lives. 








How do I stop or limit mail from Doctors Without Borders?
